name: Cinemabooking
tagline: A cinema booking system created in JAVA
body:
### Summary
This Java application was created in my first year of Computer Science at Cardiff University as part of my fundamentals of computing with Java module. It is a Swing based GUI application.

### Compile on Linux/MacOS
Open up the Sources folder in a terminal window then type;  

``
$ javac Cinema.java Ticket.java Receipt.java
``  

Then check the classes have been generated  

``
$ ls
Cinema.java Ticket.java Receipt.java Cinema.class Ticket.class Receipt.java
``  

### Run on Linux/MacOS
I have already Create class files for those that do not want to edit the code and just want to run the application. Navigate to the Classes folder in a terminal window and simply type.  

``
$ java Cinema
``  

The program window should now pop up on your screen!.

### How to use
1. Select your ticket type, desired row and time from the Combo boxes at the top of the screen  
[Select Type, Row and Time](http://imgur.com/C2RizY1,sfIKMB8,7Gn8XfB,syNIkGi#2)
2. Click on the desired seat in the highlighted row and it will change colour according to the type of ticket (to select a different row you need to change the selected row in the combo box at the top).  
[Select Seats](http://imgur.com/C2RizY1,sfIKMB8,7Gn8XfB,syNIkGi#3)  
3. Once you have selected your seats. Click the submit button at the bottom. The seats in the current window will grey out and indicate they have been booked. A new JFrame window will open with a receipt to confirm the booking details and cost.  
[Booked Seats](http://imgur.com/C2RizY1,sfIKMB8,7Gn8XfB,syNIkGi)  
[Receipt](http://imgur.com/C2RizY1,sfIKMB8,7Gn8XfB,syNIkGi#1)
